attributes.action: Reducing the Tax Burden for Domestic Employers
attributes.additional_details:
At a time when the economy is struggling, the financial burden placed on ordinary families employing domestic staff (Nannies, Au Pairs, etc) acts as an unnecessary restraint to recovery.

Rising inflation, living costs and unemployment are placing a real and threatened squeeze on household incomes.  As a result many domestic employees are losing their jobs.

This reduces tax income to HM Treasury and increases costs through benefit payments.

My proposed suspension on Employer Tax for families employing domestic help will address this.

More domestic workers will stay employed, or find new jobs and HM Treasury will benefit from the income tax of these workers and the consumption their salary allows.

Many domestic professionals dedicate years of study to gain the qualifications required to carry out their work.

It is unfair that HM Treasury is threatening their employment prospects.
